title: Wikiwand - Therapeutic touch
description: Therapeutic touch , known by some as "non-contact therapeutic touch" , is a pseudoscientific energy therapy which practitioners claim promotes healing and reduces pain and anxiety. "Therapeutic Touch" is a registered trademark in Canada for the "tructured and standardized healing practice performed by practitioners trained to be sensitive to the receiver's energy field that surrounds the body;...no touching is required."

Summarize this article for a 10 years old Therapeutic touch (commonly shortened to "TT"), known by some as "non-contact a [pseudoscientific](/en/Pseudoscience) [[2]](#cite_note-sokal-2) [energy therapy](/en/Energy_medicine) which practitioners claim promotes healing and reduces pain and anxiety. "Therapeutic Touch" is a registered trademark in Canada for the "[s]tructured and standardized healing practice performed by practitioners trained to be sensitive to the receiver's energy field that surrounds the body;...no touching is required." [[3]](#cite_note-CIPO-3) |Therapeutic touch| [MeSH](/en/Medical_Subject_Headings) [D019124](http://www.nlm.nih.gov/cgi/mesh/2011/MB_cgi?field=uid&term=D019124) Practitioners of therapeutic touch state that by placing their hands on, or near, a patient, they are able to detect and manipulate what they say is the patient's [energy field](/en/Energy_(esotericism)). [[4]](#cite_note-EoM-4) One highly cited study, designed by the then-nine-year-old [Emily Rosa](/en/Emily_Rosa) and published in the [Journal of the American Medical Association](/en/Journal_of_the_American_Medical_Association) in 1998, found that practitioners of therapeutic touch could not detect the presence or absence of a hand placed a few inches above theirs when their vision was obstructed.
